title: Update Failed Unspecified Error Occurred.
body:
Before anyone comments, yes I have looked at http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/qGY56UB4-comprehensive-troubleshooting-your-patching-issues and none of it helped.

Alright, so the issue I'm getting is that as soon as I open up the client I get this error message. If I hit try again or the x, the error immediately comes back and I have to use task manager to close League.

I've tried all the steps in the link above, and I've tried uninstalling/reinstalling completely. Nothing worked.

Does anyone know a way to fix this?

The image I set is a bit distorted, so here's a larger version of just the text in the middle:
https://i2.wp.com/yolohagrid.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/league_error_02.png?ssl=1&w=450

EDIT: Also if I try to download the launcher from the site, it simply opens up a new tab with the link 'https://riotgamespatcher-a.akamaihd.net/ShellInstaller/OC1/LeagueofLegends_OC1_Installer_2016_05_13.exe' and nothing happens. I've tried this is multiple browsers.

UPDATE: I deleted all the files and got them from my brother's computer. I can get through the launcher, however now I get a bug splat when I try to play a game.

replies.body: Me too! I tried forcing an update, still nothing.
Yup I'm having the same issue
Is there a resolution because i am running into the issue now? I've tried a complete reinstall and the error persists.

I suspect the issues stem from the URF event being so popular that they dont have the servers to run everything and some percentage of people just get bugged from the servers dropping connections left and right. enjoy the event weekend!
I have this issue now.. how do i fix?

Hmm.. It looks like your patch failure happens after 33%, therefore it's most likely caused by your patcher dropping its connection to our patching servers. The most common cause for this is if one or more local network settings conflict with your ability to properly reach our servers. To ensure this isn't the case, I'd strongly recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety!

Please let me know if this resolved your issues.

I haven't even had the chance to see any % of patching happen, after trying all the recommendations on 'http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/qGY56UB4-comprehensive-troubleshooting-your-patching-issues' i uninstalled and reinstalled my game with an old installer since 'https://riotgamespatcher-a.akamaihd.net/ShellInstaller/OC1/LeagueofLegends_OC1_Installer_2016_05_13.exe' apparently can't be reached. But the moment i see the launcher it has me accept the EULA and then instantly shows the same message Yolo Hagrid received and that is "UPDATE FAILED, Unspecified error occured. Please check the logs for more information."

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=KQtpZ9EW,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-01-10T05:09:57.233+0000)
>
> Hmm.. It looks like your patch failure happens after 33%, therefore it's most likely caused by your patcher dropping its connection to our patching servers. The most common cause for this is if one or more local network settings conflict with your ability to properly reach our servers. To ensure this isn't the case, I'd strongly recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety!
> 
> Please let me know if this resolved your issues.

Alright, to follow up on my other comment. After everything, I'm still getting the exact same error as my original post.

Would you have any idea on what else could help?

Since you're still having issues, we'll need to take a look at your system logs to figure out what else should be addressed. I recommend using our [**Hextech Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) in order to run those logs. Once you have a zipped log folder from the Hextech Tool, simply attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and one of our technical specialists will get back to you.

Let me know if you have any questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=KQtpZ9EW,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-01-10T05:09:57.233+0000)
>
> Hmm.. It looks like your patch failure happens after 33%, therefore it's most likely caused by your patcher dropping its connection to our patching servers. The most common cause for this is if one or more local network settings conflict with your ability to properly reach our servers. To ensure this isn't the case, I'd strongly recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety!
> 
> Please let me know if this resolved your issues.

So I pretty much tried everything. I did the dns server change thing and reset my computer. League has opened up and begun an update, which is more than it was doing before. I'll keep you updated on if it completes or fails, but for now it seems okay.

After it's fixed, should I go and change my dns server setting back to what they were? or will that break League when I try to open it in the future?

And thanks for the help Mr. Red Name! :)
Exactly the same Issue I'm having! I hope we get some help with this, i really wanted to play league today {{item:3070}}
Also having this same issue all of a sudden. All of the comments are from 7 months ago or today, so sounds like an old issue that resurfaced?
I am having this issue right now as well. Was hoping there would be a fix by now...

I left the launcher on the error code for a couple minutes while searching for answers. After finding this page, I then clicked "retry" and it started loading. Maybe it is just the URF weekend as LeagueofBoners mentioned further up this page. We'll see if it fully loads and plays.
same, when i got on the new client, the error message popped up and all i could do was keep on retrying, but now, after 30 mins, its starting to patch. :D

im having the same issue as well, as soon as i opened, league, the unspecified error message popped up. I tried re downloading it completely and also used the hextech repair tool but none of that worked as i still immediately get the error message. BTW it doesnt even load to 33%, it just says "1 file scanned" and stays like that in the back while the error message is there.

OK so I went into control panel and uninstalled. Then I went into the files and deleted everything (because the uninstall thinks its ok to leave a  bunch of files laying around I guess (like **THAT**'s not going to cause an issue... smh)). Then I restarted my computer. Then I went to the site to do a fresh reinstall (all default install settings). THEN when it failed I right click the shortcut and click 'go to file location' and I run the **lol.launcher.admin.exe**    NOT the lol.launcher.exe  . This seems to get the client to patch up.. aaaaand I'm into the client, just waiting for the update. Either this works or they got some additional servers up to handle the URF event traffic *cough* anyways I really hope this helps. Let me know
holy sh!t, its actullay patching, thanks for the info, but will i have to do this all the time?

lol so it will load up to 100% and then kicks you back out into the loop. 
At this point I'm fairly certain that it's entirely server side, we'll just have to wait for rito to figure it out. Again, these issues pop up every time URF event comes along. It's because as a free to play game (with various other business model nuances that actually make riot a pretty great company for their employees and players) but they do have limited server availability, which I understand. But this is a predictable volume increase. That's a little disappointing..

*Just periodically going through the loop got me through, sorry for taking you on my goose chase
I am have the same issue
For whatever reason, the new patch has fixed the problem. I'm not sure what it was, or what was going on, but it's working now.
HAvent been on league in so long... Same prob. Mines can go to 99% and dont work... SIGhs i dont want to play a new game.. I love league

As with all the other comments on this thread, I am also having the same issue. Tried Reinstalling through the Hextech Repair tool, tried force patching, but to no avail. Hopefully this issue gets fixed asap.

FeelsBadMan.
